newsitem.title: USA: Cap on CRP entry is "assault" on farms - US group.
newsitem.headline: Cap on CRP entry is "assault" on farms - US group.

text.p: The National Association of Wheat Growers said it was stunned by the House Appropriations Committee vote Thursday to cap new enrollments in the Conservation Reserve Program at 14 million acres this year.

"The acreage cap is a direct assault...on the most important environmental protection program for cropland," said NAWG president Phil McLain. "The limit imposted on fiscal 1997 enrollments will dramatically affect use of the CRP to reduce soil erosion, provide wildlife habitat and improve water quality."
NAWG was among 30 conservation and farm groups who sent letters to House and Senate appropriations committee leaders asking for full use of CRP.

Contracts on 21 million acres now in CRP expire at the end of September. Farmers have offered 25.6 million acres for enrollment. The Agriculture Department has said it might accept up to 19 million acres this year.
